channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Banks want in on Tether’s billions in stablecoin profits
item.description: Tether is on track to close the year with more than $10 billion in net profits, according to CEO Paolo Ardoino.

item.title: Jeju Air jet crashes in South Korea with over 170 dead or missing
item.description: The crash took place at around 9 a.m. Seoul time and marks the first fatal accident for low-cost carrier Jeju Air.

item.title: The Gift of Traveling Through Time
item.description: The diary I kept this past year offers me an express ticket back to beautiful moments I’ve lived.

item.title: Behind the Dismantling of Hezbollah: Decades of Israeli Intelligence
item.description: A Times investigation shows how extensively Israel penetrated the Lebanese militia, closely tracking the group’s commanders and culminating in the ass...

item.title: Boeing 737-800, a Precursor to the 737 Max, Is Used Widely.
item.description: Nearly 200 airlines use the 737-800, which makes up about 15 percent of the world’s fleet of aircraft.

item.title: How An Underground Church for L.G.B.T. Africans Has Thrived in Kenya
item.description: The congregation in Nairobi, Kenya, has been forced to move to 10 different locations over 10 years, and yet it has survived as a sanctuary in an incr...

item.title: AT&T says its network is now clear after Salt Typhoon hack
item.description: The hackers attempted to gain information about foreign intelligence, AT&T said Saturday in a statement.

item.title: How An Underground Church for L.G.B.T. Africans Has Thrived in Kenya
item.description: The congregation in Nairobi, Kenya, has been forced to move to 10 different locations over 10 years, and yet it has survived as a sanctuary in an incr...

item.title: Big Lots reaches deal to keep hundreds of US stores open after filing for bankruptcy
item.description: Variety Wholesalers Inc. plans to acquire between 200 and 400 Big Lots stores and operate them under the Big Lots brand.

item.title: South Korea’s Acting President Has Only Been in Office Since Friday
item.description: After two impeachments of leaders in two weeks, the country is deep into a political crisis.

item.title: Live Updates: Jeju Air Flight Crashes in South Korea, Killing More Than 150
item.description: The passenger plane was landing when it went off the runway in Muan, in the country’s southwest. The flight came from Bangkok and was carrying 181 peo...

item.title: Boeing 737-800, a Precursor to the 737 Max, Is Used Widely.
item.description: Nearly 200 airlines use the 737-800, which makes up about 15 percent of the world’s fleet of aircraft.

item.title: ‘Never take health tips from a centenarian,’ say experts—this is what you should do to live longer
item.description: Longevity comes down to a multitude of factors—including luck and genetics.

item.title: Ignoring Warnings, a Growing Band of Tourists Venture to Afghanistan
item.description: With the war now over, the Taliban are welcoming foreign travelers, even as governments advise their citizens to stay away.
